TextView.android:text: Food Temperature: Something else you should consider is not feeding your blended meals cold. If you have meals stored in the refrigerator, you can take it out a few hours before the feeding to allow some of the chill to knock off. I personally have a warmer similar to what mothers use to warm baby bottles. That way, the blended meal is the prefect temperature. Every once in a while, especially during the summer months I might give a cool beverage through their tube, but overall I personally preprefer room temperature or warm. I understand eating food hot or cold is just a matter of personal and tradition preference. But I have found that people (especially people with feeding tubes) digest food better when it is warm. RECIPE BY MOM: VALERIA PARSONS
